sentences.sentence: After that they both went to the youngest, and said, “You certainly found the Water of Life, but you have had the pain, and we the gain( 收获 ).
You should have been sharper( 更聪明 ), and should have kept your eyes open.
We took it from you whilst you were asleep at sea, and when a year is over, one of us will go and fetch( 去接 ) the beautiful Princess( 公主 ).
But do not say anything of this to our father.
He is angry at you and does not trust you.
If you say a single word, you shall lose your life, but if you keep silent , then perhaps he will let you live.”
The old King was indeed angry with his youngest son, and thought he had tried to kill his own father.
So he decided to have the youngest son killed.

Once when the Prince( 王子 ) had gone out to hunt( 打猎 ) with the King’s huntsman( 猎人 ), and when they were quite alone in the forest, the huntsman looked so sad that the prince said to him, “Dear huntsman, what’s wrong?”
The huntsman said, “I cannot tell you, and yet I ought.”
Then the prince said, “Say openly what it is, I will forgive( 原谅 ) you.”
“Alas( 唉 )!” said the huntsman, “I am supposed to( 应该 ) kill you: the King has ordered me to do it.”
Then the Prince was shocked( 震惊的 ), and said, “Dear huntsman, let me live. I will give you my royal clothing; give me your ordinary clothes instead.”
The huntsman said, “I will willingly do that, indeed I could never kill you.”
Then they exchanged( 交换 ) clothes, and the huntsman returned home.
The prince, however, went further into the forest.
After a time three wagons( 马车 ) full of gold and precious( 珍贵的 ) stones came to the King for his youngest son.
These were sent by the three Kings who had killed their enemies with the Prince’s sword( 剑 ), and fed( 为...提供食物 ) their people with his bread, and who wished to show their thanks.
The old King then thought, “Can my son have been innocent( 无辜的 )?” and said to his people, “If only he were still alive—how sorry I am that I had him killed!”
“He still lives,” said the huntsman. “I could not find it in my heart to carry out your command( 命令 ),” and told the King how it had happened.
Then a stone fell from the King’s heart, and he spread the news in every country that his son might return and be safe and respected again.
Meanwhile( 与此同时 ), the Princess, had a golden road built at the entrance to her palace.
She told her people that whoever came riding straight along it, would be the right person and was to be admitted( 允许...进入 ),
but whoever rode by the side of it was not the right person, and should be turned away.
As the year was almost over, the eldest thought he would hurry to the King’s daughter,
and say that he was the one who had saved her, and thus win her for his bride( 新娘 ), and the kingdom as well.
Therefore, he rode out, and when he arrived in front of the palace and saw the splendid( 华丽的 ) golden road, he thought it would be wrong for him to ride over that,
and turned aside( 到一边 ), and rode on the right side of it.
But when he came to the door, the servants told him that he was not the right man, and was to go away again.
Soon after this the second son came.
When he came to the golden road, and his horse had put one foot on it, he thought it would be a shame to damage( 损坏 ) it, and he turned aside and rode on the left side of it.
When he reached the door, the attendants( 侍从 ) told him he was not the right one, and he was to go away again.
At the very end of the year, the third son also wished to ride out of the forest to see the Princess, and with her forget his sorrows( 痛苦 ).
So he set out and thought of her so constantly( 持续不断地 ), and wished to be with her so much, that he never noticed the golden road at all.
So his horse rode right up the middle of it.
When he came to the door, it was opened and the Princess received him with joy( 喜悦 ), and said he had saved her and was now lord of the kingdom.
Their wedding( 婚礼 ) was celebrated with great rejoicing( 喜庆 ).
When it was over she told him that his father wanted him to come back.
So he rode home and told his father everything that had happened between him and his brothers.
The old King wished to punish them, but they had gone to sea, and never came back as long as( 只要 ) they lived.

article_info.previous: 在小矮人和公主的帮助下，小王子顺利找到了生命之水并和公主订下婚约。在回程的路上，小王子不顾小矮人的警告救下了自己的两个哥哥，还把许多国家从战争与饥饿中解救出来。两个哥哥却恩将仇报，离间国王和小王子。

question.en: What did the King order the huntsman to do?

options.en: To shut the third prince in the prison.
To send the third prince to the seaside.

analysis: 文中提到：“Alas!” said the huntsman, “I am supposed to kill you: the King has ordered me to do it.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 小王子为什么没注意到这条金制的路？
question.en: Why didn’t the third prince pay attention to the golden road?

options.cn: 因为痛苦的经历，他的视力变弱了。
options.en: Because he had weak eyes because of bitterness.
Because he could not recognize the gold.

options.cn: 因为他非常想念公主，急切地希望和她在一起。
options.en: Because he missed the princess and eagerly wished to be with her.

analysis: 文中提到：“So he set out and thought of her so constantly, and wished to be with her so much, that he never noticed the golden road at all.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 国王最后知道真相了吗？
question.en: Did the King know the truth in the end?

analysis: 文中提到：“When it was over she told him that his father wanted him to come back. So he rode home and told his father everything that had happened between him and his brothers.” 因此答案选A。
